response.answer_text: By the phrase “start the religion of islam” I think you mean to say when did he started preaching it? Muhammad(PBUH) received his first revelation in 610 AD. He was not used to seeing angels around him, so when Gabriel arrived with the divine message, Muhammad (PBUH) was afraid. So he preached his among his family members. Khadija bin Khuwaylid was the first convert to Islam. Ali ibn Abu Talib was the first male convert. For three years Muhammad(PBUH) preached his message secretly. However one of the converts Abu Bakr started inviting his close friends to Islam and Uthman bin Affan, Talhah bin Ubaydullah, Az Zubayr ibnul Awwam, Saad ibn Abi Waqqas were converted on Abu Bakr’s invitation. It was in 613 AD that Muhammad(PBUH) started preaching in public. He invited the senior Quraysh leaders to Islam. He invited the negro slaves to Islam. The negro slaves started converting in large numbers as Islam gave them the dignity to live as equals in the Arab society. Prominent slave converts were Ammar bin Al Yasir and Bilal ibn Rabah. This prompted the Meccan Quraysh leaders to action. Abu Jahl, Utbah ibn Rabiah, Ummayah ibn Khalaf tortured the early converts. But Islam still came out victorious in the end!!!!!

Islam was founded after 40 years of Prophet Muhammad (SAW) Birth.When he was in “Cave of Sor”, Angel Gibrael come to him and give him the first message or “Wahi” from Allah. At First, Prophet was shocked, he didn’t even believe what he saw few moments ago.and after some passage of Time He understand that he is the Messenger of Allah and then He start getting “Wahi” Regularly.Then he start Preaching The message of Allah and many people accept his (SAW) beliefs and start following him. After 13 year of Prophet-hood He left Mecca for Madina. As People of Mecca (majority of them) were against him. So he decided to leave Mecca and Build a State of Islam, which was Madina. Through this Islam Spread throughout the world.

Technically, Islam wasn’t founded it was something that you have when you was born and then you leave it as you grow or follow it to be grown by it. The Muslim (faith-based) answer: With the arrival of Adam on earth - but some scholarly accounts go way before that (to the creation of the first conscientious being by the Creator - which immediately established the philosophical cause/effect relationship). Islam, of course, means submission to the will of the One God. The historical (textbook) answer: The year 610 C.E (with the advent of the first Quranic revelation).

Most religious historians view Islam as having been founded in 622 CE by Muhammad the Prophet (peace be upon him).* He lived from about 570 to 632 CE). The religion started in Mecca, when the angel Jibril (a.k.a. Jibreel; Gabriel in English) read the first revelation to Muhammad (pbuh). (Mohammed and Muhammed (pbuh) are alternative spellings for his name.) Islam is the youngest of the world's very large religions -- those with over 300 million members -- which include Christianity, Islam, Hinduism and Buddhism.

Muhammad was the last prophet sent by God. Therefore, by simple logic he didn’t start Islam, he is a messenger from God. For those who say he started Islam, they need to explain what were the previous prophets preaching? Islam means to voluntary “Submit” or “Surrender” to the will of God. The term Islam/Muslims was used by prophet Ibrahim as stated in the Quran Surah Al-Haj [22:78]: [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. He has named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. Islam is not really a name to be used as a noun to refer to a group of people. It is rather a state of mind.
